result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Mark Devon Nellum

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Mark Devon Nellum appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Brett Lee Copeland appeared in Court for Mark Devon Nellum.  Attorney Joshua Miles Mathy appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. 

Case in Court for Scheduling Conference. Discussion placed on the record. Defense provided an update to the Court regarding discovery material and requested an additional status date. State confirmed. Case adjourned for Status hearing, Branch 46. Status hearing scheduled for November 21, 2022 at 09:45 am. Hearing will be held via Zoom Video Conference.

Defendant Mark Devon Nellum appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Brett Lee Copeland appeared by video for Mark Devon Nellum.  Attorney  Owen Piotrowski appeared on behalf of Attorney Joshua Miles Mathy for State of Wisconsin. 

**JUDGE FEISS AND ALL PARTIES APPEARED VIA ZOOM VIDEO CONFERENCE.** 
Case in Court for Scheduling Conference. Discussion placed on the record. Defense received discovery material from the State. Defense advised the Court regarding Discovery issue. Defense requested an adjournment to allow time to review Discovery and complete investigation. Court ordered case adjourned for Scheduling Conference. Case remains calendared in Branch 46. Hearing will be held via Zoom Video Conference.
Scheduling conference scheduled for October 21, 2022 at 10:30 am.

Attorney Brett Lee Copeland in Court, Defendant Mark Devon Nellum not in Court, in custody.  John J Rejowski on behalf of Joshua Miles Mathy appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

HELD OFF THE RECORD VIA ZOOM VIDEO CONFERENCE.
Case in Court for Scheduling Conference. Clerk previously made arrangements for Defendant to appear via Zoom; however, Defendant did not appear for today's hearing. Defense has NOT received an offer from the State. Case adjourned for Scheduling Conference, Branch 46. Scheduling Conference scheduled for September 16, 2022 at 09:15 am. Hearing will be held via Zoom Video Conference.

Scheduling Conference scheduled for August 12, 2022 at 09:30 am.
Hearing will be held via Zoom Video Conference.

Defendant Mark Devon Nellum in court with Attorney Brett Lee Copeland.  Defendant Mark Devon Nellum in custody.  Karine O'Byrne appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  PARTIES APPEAR BY VIDEO.
Court took judicial notice of 08CF1124. Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the State: MPD Detective Z. Johnson. State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 46.  Scheduling conference scheduled for August 12, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Mark Devon Nellum not in court, defendant in custody.  Adam Joseph Best appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case set for Preliminary hearing. State Public Defenders Office needs more time to appoint counsel. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for July 21, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Court ordered no contact with G.S.
No Contact/No Weapons Order, signed and filed.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 4.
  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Mark Devon Nellum in court with attorney Edgar A Beltran.  Defendant Mark Devon Nellum in custody.  Alexander James Geocaris appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Feiss, Branch 46. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 21, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
